description: The file that Katana will use for slice creation. It will be created by the slice mapping process based on the received GST

sst.description: Slice/Service Type - Refers to the expected Network Slice behaviour

sd.description: Service Differentiator - Optional information that complements the Slice/Service type(s) to differentiate amongst multiple Network Slices of the same SST

coverage.description: A list with all the locations that are part of the slice

items.description: The location name for each site in the slice

ns_list.description: List of the NSD to be instantiated alongside the slice

nfvo_id.description: The NFVO responsible for the NS LCM

ems-id.description: Optional - Defines the EMS that is responsible for D1&2 configuration

shared.description: A network slice instance may be fully or partly, logically and/or physically, isolated from another network slice instance

isolation.description: 0: No Isolation 1: Physical Isolation 2: Logical Isolation 3: Full Isolation

simultaneous_nsi.description: 0: Can be used with any network slice 1: Can be used with network slices with same SST value 2: Can be used with any network slice with same SD value 3: Cannot be used with another network slice 4-15: operator defined class

network_DL_throughput.description: The achievable data rate in downlink for the whole network slice (and not per user).

ue_DL_throughput.description: This attribute describes the guaranteed data rate supported by the network slice per UE in downlink

network_UL_throughput.description: The achievable data rate in uplink for the whole network slice (and not per user).

ue_UL_throughput.description: This attribute describes the guaranteed data rate supported by the network slice per UE in uplink

group_communication_support.description: 0: not available 1: Single Cell Point to Multipoint (SCPTM) 2: Broadcast/Multicast 3: Broadcast/Multicast + SC-PTM

number_of_terminals.description: This attribute describes the maximum number of concurrent terminals supported by the network slice.

positional_support.description: This attribute describes if the network slice provides geo-localization methods or supporting methods.

availability.description: Describes if this attribute is provided by the network slice and contains a list of positioning methods provided by the slice.

items.description: 1: CID 2: E-CID (LTE and NR) 3: OTDOA (LTE and NR) 4: RF fingerprinting 5: AECID 6: Hybrid positioning 7: NET-RTK

radio_spectrum.description: Defines the radio spectrum supported by the network slice.

items.description: This attribute simply tells which frequencies can be used to access the network slice. Example: n1, n77, n38

device_velocity.description: 1: Stationary: 0 km/h 2: Pedestrian: 0 km/h to 10 km/h 3: Vehicular: 10 km/h to 120 km/h 4: High speed vehicular: 120 km/h to 500 km/h

terminal_density.description: maximum number of connected and/or accessible devices per unit area (per km2) supported by the network slice [Number/km^2]

probe_list.description: A list of probe ids to be included in the slice
